ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] all I can say is hmmmm
ygData.msgSnippet: I m not sure if it is funny or sad.  I do hope we don t suddenly see a bunch of characters who couldn t get in a group on their old server due to their
ygData.messageBody:
I'm not sure if it is funny or sad. I do hope we don't suddenly see a bunch
of characters who couldn't get in a group on their old server due to their
unsavory ways suddenly dropped on unsuspecting high level groups elsewhere.

Kitasi

-----Original Message-----
From: Cranfill, Wendy [mailto:Wendy_Cranfill@...]
Sent: Monday, July 09, 2001 10:28 AM
To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] all I can say is hmmmm


I know I shouldn't be laughing but I am...

Wonder if they will take a survey when you move characters so we can see
graphs and charts about how many moved to escape bad reputations, how many
are running from the guild from whom they ninja'd uber-gear, and how many
are moving because of a broken relationship caused by too much EQ. Kinda
funny when you think about it :)

Halana/Tani
Solusek Ro



> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
> Sent: Monday, July 09, 2001 10:21 AM
> To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] all I can say is hmmmm
>
>
> Well, this is a bit different Talies. Imagine you are a live together
> couple that have parted ways, now you can actually keep your
> character when
> you split.
>
> Kitasi
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Talies the Wanderer [mailto:snicker@...]
> Sent: Friday, July 06, 2001 10:47 AM
> To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] all I can say is hmmmm
>
>
> At 11:35 AM 7/6/2001 -0500, you wrote:
> >Seems to me that with what they are charging - it's going to
> be a "profit
> >center" for Verant. I'm concerned that Bards will be the
> type of character
> >where we'll see significant E-Bay'ers. I expect to see a
> lot of bards in
> SS
> >and POG armor with no idea how the songs work - let alone twisting.
> >
> >I don't really understand the mentality. I know I'm not
> alone in feeling
> >the early levels could be among the most fun - and learning
> the class was a
> >blast. I really enjoy getting tells from people who've
> found me randomly
> >with esoteric questions about being a bard - and stuff
> that's rarely used
> >(had one recently about the Identify Magic song).
>
>
> Anyone from DragonRealms remember the stink made when they announced
> platinum service?
>
> *grumbles*
> I didn't sub to that, and I won't sub to it here. I think it's a
> disgusting practice, to separate people based on economics.
>
> Talies the Wanderer
>
>
> Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to

> with the subject submissions.
